ground_truth: The letter is addressed to Marius, and Eponine opens it, reads it, and looks distressed. Rain pours down, soaking the cobbled street as Eponine slowly walks through the darkness, soaked to the skin. Student protesters and townspeople line a street by the Place de la Bastille, while Gavroche and the urchins are in the elephant. Soldiers march down the street followed by cavalry, with the large black hearse for General Lamarque behind them. Enjolras waves a red flag and climbs onto the street, joined by Marius and the others. Javert is in the crowd as the cavalry face the protesters, who are grouped around the hearse. Enjolras and Marius cock pistols as soldiers raise their swords and aim their muskets. A soldier shoots into the crowd, hitting a woman who collapses. Cavalry charges, and men exchange fire with the soldiers. Enjolras shoots as one of the students, Courfeyrac, is knocked down, but Javert, dressed as a civilian, helps him up. Marius rides down the street as a cart is overturned and furniture is thrown from windows to build the barricade. A cannon is pulled into place, and students shoot from behind the barricade. People with guns chase the cavalry down the street, and protesters run through the streets. Marius finds a canoodling couple as a table is taken, and he beams with excitement while Courfeyrac calls out. Tables and pianos are thrown from windows. In a cafe, Javert steals a rosette and pins it to his dark jacket. A couch and a cart form the barricade, which blocks the street, and an old woman is kissed as her chair is taken. Javert takes a pistol. A red flag is thrown to Marius, and Enjolras climbs onto the top of the barricade and waves the flag while people wave tricolors from their windows. Javert returns, and they raise their weapons. Javert throws off the men holding him and lays a few punches, but the students overwhelm him as Enjolras knocks him out with a club. Enjolras and Marius look around with concern, grab their weapons, and head to the barricade with the group. A woman closes her shutters, and the students man the barricade and aim their weapons. A platoon of soldiers marches up the street to face them as light flickers on Enjolras's face and sparking gunpowder lights up the street. Students return fire as soldiers climb up the barricade and shoot through it, leaving a soldier dead on top. Marius grabs a barrel of gunpowder, which flames up, and Gavroche calls out. Eponine is behind the barricade and grabs a musket aimed at Marius, getting shot in the process. Marius has a torch and lowers the flaming torch towards the gunpowder. The officer turns to his men, who back away. Breathless, Enjolras takes the torch from Marius.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The missive is directed to Marius, and Eponine unseals it, peruses it, and appears troubled. Precipitation cascades down, drenching the cobblestone avenue as Eponine leisurely traverses through the obscurity, drenched to the skin. Scholar activists and townspeople line a thoroughfare by the Place de la Bastille, while Gavroche and the ragamuffins are in the pachyderm. Troopers parade down the thoroughfare followed by horsemen, with the sizable ebony hearse for General Lamarque behind them. Enjolras brandishes a crimson banner and ascends onto the thoroughfare, accompanied by Marius and the others. Javert is in the throng as the horsemen confront the activists, who are clustered around the hearse. Enjolras and Marius prime pistols as troopers elevate their sabers and target their muskets. A trooper fires into the throng, striking a female who collapses. Horsemen charge, and men swap shots with the troopers. Enjolras fires as one of the scholars, Courfeyrac, is knocked down, but Javert, dressed as a civilian, assists him up. Marius rides down the thoroughfare as a cart is overturned and furnishings are hurled from windows to erect the barricade. A cannon is dragged into position, and scholars fire from behind the barricade. People with firearms pursue the horsemen down the thoroughfare, and activists dash through the streets. Marius discovers an amorous pair as a table is taken, and he beams with enthusiasm while Courfeyrac calls out. Tables and pianos are hurled from windows. In a bistro, Javert purloins a rosette and affixes it to his somber jacket. A couch and a cart shape the barricade, which obstructs the thoroughfare, and an elderly woman is kissed as her chair is taken. Javert seizes a pistol. A crimson banner is tossed to Marius, and Enjolras climbs onto the top of the barricade and waves the banner while people wave tricolors from their windows. Javert returns, and they raise their armaments. Javert throws off the men clasping him and delivers a few blows, but the scholars overpower him as Enjolras knocks him out with a cudgel. Enjolras and Marius gaze around with apprehension, seize their armaments, and head to the barricade with the group. A female closes her shutters, and the scholars man the barricade and target their armaments. A platoon of troopers marches up the thoroughfare to confront them as illumination flickers on Enjolras's visage and sparking gunpowder illuminates the thoroughfare. Scholars retaliate as troopers climb up the barricade and shoot through it, leaving a trooper deceased on top. Marius grabs a barrel of gunpowder, which flares up, and Gavroche calls out. Eponine is behind the barricade and seizes a musket aimed at Marius, getting shot in the process. Marius has a torch and lowers the blazing torch towards the gunpowder. The officer turns to his men, who retreat. Breathless, Enjolras takes the torch from Marius.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The letter was addressed to Marius, and it is opened, read, and looked at with distress by Eponine. The cobbled street is soaked by pouring rain as Eponine slowly walks through the darkness, soaked to the skin. A street by the Place de la Bastille is lined by student protesters and townspeople, while Gavroche and the urchins occupy the elephant. The street is marched down by soldiers followed by cavalry, with General Lamarque's large black hearse behind them. A red flag is waved by Enjolras, who climbs onto the street, and he is joined by Marius and the others. In the crowd is Javert as the protesters face the cavalry, who are grouped around the hearse. Pistols are cocked by Enjolras and Marius as swords are raised and muskets are aimed by soldiers. Into the crowd, a soldier shoots, hitting a woman who collapses. A charge is made by the cavalry, and the soldiers are exchanged fire with by the men. As one of the students, Courfeyrac, is knocked down, a shot is fired by Enjolras, but he is helped up by Javert, dressed as a civilian. Marius rides down the street as a cart is overturned and furniture is thrown from windows to build the barricade. Into place, a cannon is pulled, and from behind the barricade, the students shoot. The cavalry is chased down the street by people with guns, and the streets are run through by protesters. A canoodling couple is found by Marius as a table is taken, and he beams with excitement while Courfeyrac calls out. From windows, tables and pianos are thrown. In a cafe, a rosette is stolen by Javert and pinned to his dark jacket. The barricade is formed by a couch and a cart, which blocks the street, and an old woman is kissed as her chair is taken. A pistol is taken by Javert. A red flag is thrown to Marius, and onto the top of the barricade climbs Enjolras, waving the flag while tricolors are waved from their windows by people. Javert returns, and their weapons are raised. Off the men holding him, Javert throws himself and lays a few punches, but he is overwhelmed by the students as he is knocked out by Enjolras with a club. With concern, Enjolras and Marius look around, grab their weapons, and to the barricade, they head with the group. Her shutters are closed by a woman, and the barricade is manned by the students who aim their weapons. Up the street, a platoon of soldiers marches to face them as Enjolras's face is flickered with light and the street is lit up by sparking gunpowder. Fire is returned by the students as the barricade is climbed by soldiers who shoot through it, leaving a soldier dead on top. A barrel of gunpowder is grabbed by Marius, and it flames up as Gavroche calls out. Behind the barricade, Eponine grabs a musket aimed at Marius, getting herself shot in the process. A torch is held by Marius, and the flaming torch is lowered towards the gunpowder. To his men, the officer turns, causing them to back away. Breathless, the torch is taken from Marius by Enjolras.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The letter, which is carefully addressed to Marius, is opened by Eponine, who reads its contents and subsequently appears visibly distressed. As the rain pours down relentlessly, soaking the cobbled street, Eponine slowly makes her way through the darkness, drenched to the skin by the downpour. Meanwhile, student protesters and townspeople gather along a street near the Place de la Bastille, while Gavroche and the urchins find refuge in the elephant. Soldiers march down the street in a disciplined formation, followed closely by cavalry, with the large, somber black hearse for General Lamarque trailing behind them. Enjolras, full of fervor, waves a vibrant red flag and climbs onto the street, joined by Marius and the other determined individuals. In the midst of the crowd, Javert is present as the cavalry confronts the protesters, who are gathered around the hearse. Enjolras and Marius prepare their pistols as soldiers raise their swords and aim their muskets with precision. A soldier fires into the crowd, tragically hitting a woman who collapses to the ground. The cavalry charges forward, and men exchange gunfire with the soldiers. Enjolras fires his weapon as one of the students, Courfeyrac, is knocked down, but Javert, disguised as a civilian, assists him in getting back up. Marius rides down the street with urgency as a cart is overturned and furniture is hurled from windows to construct the barricade. A cannon is strategically pulled into place, and students fire from behind the barricade. Armed individuals chase the cavalry down the street, and protesters run through the bustling streets. Marius encounters a couple in an intimate embrace as a table is seized, and he beams with excitement while Courfeyrac calls out. Tables and pianos are thrown from windows with force. Inside a cafe, Javert stealthily steals a rosette and pins it to his dark jacket. A couch and a cart are used to form the barricade, effectively blocking the street, and an old woman is kissed as her chair is taken. Javert takes hold of a pistol. A red flag is tossed to Marius, and Enjolras climbs to the top of the barricade, waving the flag triumphantly while people wave tricolors from their windows. Javert returns, and they raise their weapons in readiness. Javert throws off the men restraining him and delivers a few punches, but the students overpower him as Enjolras knocks him out with a club. Enjolras and Marius, filled with concern, look around, grab their weapons, and head to the barricade with the group. A woman closes her shutters, and the students man the barricade, aiming their weapons with determination. A platoon of soldiers marches up the street to confront them as light flickers on Enjolras's face, and sparking gunpowder illuminates the street. Students return fire as soldiers climb up the barricade and shoot through it, leaving a soldier lifeless on top. Marius seizes a barrel of gunpowder, which ignites with flames, and Gavroche calls out. Eponine, positioned behind the barricade, grabs a musket aimed at Marius, getting shot in the process. Marius holds a torch and lowers the flaming torch towards the gunpowder. The officer turns to his men, who instinctively back away. Breathless and determined, Enjolras takes the torch from Marius.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The letter, which is meticulously and carefully addressed to Marius, is opened by Eponine. She reads its contents thoroughly and subsequently appears visibly distressed, her expression marked by evident concern. As the rain pours down relentlessly, drenching everything in sight and soaking the cobbled street, Eponine slowly and deliberately makes her way through the encompassing darkness, thoroughly drenched to the skin by the unyielding downpour. Meanwhile, student protesters and townspeople gather purposefully along a street situated near the Place de la Bastille, while Gavroche and the street urchins find temporary refuge and shelter in the elephant. Soldiers march down the street with precision in a disciplined and orderly formation, followed closely by cavalry, with the large, somber black hearse for General Lamarque trailing solemnly behind them. Enjolras, brimming with fervor and passion, energetically waves a vibrant red flag and climbs onto the street, joined by Marius and the other determined individuals. In the midst of the crowd, Javert is present as the cavalry confronts the resolute protesters, who have gathered around the hearse. Enjolras and Marius prepare their pistols as soldiers raise their swords and aim their muskets with precision. A soldier fires into the crowd, tragically hitting a woman who collapses lifeless to the ground. The cavalry charges forward, and men engage in a fierce exchange of gunfire with the soldiers. Enjolras fires his weapon as one of the students, Courfeyrac, is knocked down, but Javert, cunningly disguised as a civilian, assists him in getting back up. Marius rides urgently down the street as a cart is overturned and furniture is hurled from windows to construct the barricade. A cannon is strategically pulled into place, and students fire from behind the makeshift barricade. Armed individuals chase the retreating cavalry down the street, and protesters dash through the chaotic, bustling streets. Marius encounters a couple locked in an intimate embrace as a table is seized, and he beams with excitement while Courfeyrac calls out. Tables and pianos are forcefully thrown from windows with intensity. Inside a cafe, Javert stealthily steals a rosette and pins it to his dark jacket discretely. A couch and a cart are used to effectively form the barricade, efficiently blocking the street, and an old woman is kissed tenderly as her chair is taken to aid the cause. Javert determinedly takes hold of a pistol. A red flag is energetically tossed to Marius, and Enjolras climbs to the top of the towering barricade, waving the flag triumphantly while people enthusiastically wave tricolors from their windows. Javert returns, and they raise their weapons in readiness for confrontation. Javert throws off the men restraining him with force and delivers a few powerful punches, but the students ultimately overpower him as Enjolras knocks him out decisively with a club. Enjolras and Marius, filled with deep concern, look around cautiously, grab their weapons, and make their way to the barricade with the group. A woman closes her shutters, and the students man the barricade, aiming their weapons with steadfast determination. A platoon of soldiers marches up the street to confront them as light flickers on Enjolras's face, and sparking gunpowder illuminates the street. Students resolutely return fire as soldiers climb up the barricade and shoot through it, leaving a fallen soldier lifeless on top. Marius decisively seizes a barrel of gunpowder, which ignites dramatically with flames, and Gavroche calls out with urgency. Eponine, positioned steadfastly behind the barricade, courageously grabs a musket aimed at Marius, getting shot in the process. Marius firmly holds a torch and lowers the flaming torch towards the gunpowder. The officer turns to his men, who instinctively back away in caution. Breathless and determined, Enjolras takes the torch from Marius with resolve.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The letter, carefully addressed to Marius, is gently opened by Eponine, who unfolds it with anticipation and begins to read its contents. As her eyes scan the words, a look of distress gradually spreads across her face. Outside, the rain pours relentlessly, drenching the cobbled street as Eponine steps out into the night, her clothes quickly becoming soaked through as she slowly makes her way through the darkness. Meanwhile, student protesters and townspeople gather along a street near the Place de la Bastille, their presence marked by a sense of urgency and determination. Gavroche and the urchins find refuge inside the elephant statue, observing the scene below. Soldiers march in disciplined formation down the street, their footsteps echoing, followed closely by cavalry, and behind them looms the large black hearse carrying General Lamarque. Enjolras, filled with fervor, waves a red flag high in the air and climbs onto the street, where he is soon joined by Marius and the other students. In the crowd, Javert stands inconspicuously as the cavalry confronts the protesters, who have gathered around the hearse. Enjolras and Marius, with steely resolve, cock their pistols in preparation as soldiers raise their swords and aim their muskets at the crowd. The tension breaks when a soldier fires into the crowd, striking a woman who collapses to the ground. The cavalry charges forward, and chaos ensues as men exchange gunfire with the soldiers. Enjolras takes aim and shoots, while Courfeyrac, one of the students, is knocked down, only to be helped up by Javert, who is disguised as a civilian. Marius, filled with determination, rides down the street as a cart is overturned and furniture is hurled from windows to construct the barricade. A cannon is maneuvered into position, and students take cover behind the barricade, firing at the advancing soldiers. Armed citizens chase the cavalry down the street, and protesters scatter through the streets. Marius stumbles upon a couple in an intimate embrace as a table is seized, and he beams with excitement while Courfeyrac calls out to him. Tables and pianos crash down from windows, adding to the barricade's fortifications. Inside a cafe, Javert discreetly steals a rosette and pins it to his dark jacket, blending in with the revolutionaries. A couch and a cart are strategically placed to form the barricade, effectively blocking the street, and an old woman is kissed as her chair is taken for the cause. Javert arms himself with a pistol. A red flag is tossed to Marius, and Enjolras climbs to the top of the barricade, proudly waving the flag as people lean out of their windows, waving tricolors in solidarity. Javert returns to the scene, and the revolutionaries raise their weapons in readiness. Javert, with a sudden burst of energy, throws off the men restraining him and delivers a few punches, but the students quickly overpower him, and Enjolras knocks him out with a club. Enjolras and Marius exchange concerned glances, grab their weapons, and join the group heading to the barricade. A woman hurriedly closes her shutters as the students take their positions, aiming their weapons with determination. A platoon of soldiers marches up the street, ready to confront the barricade, as flickering light illuminates Enjolras's face and sparking gunpowder casts an eerie glow on the street. The students return fire as soldiers attempt to climb the barricade, shooting through it, leaving one soldier dead atop the structure. Marius seizes a barrel of gunpowder, which ignites with a burst of flame, and Gavroche calls out in alarm. Behind the barricade, Eponine bravely grabs a musket aimed at Marius, sacrificing herself as she is shot in the process. Marius, holding a torch, lowers it towards the gunpowder, ready to ignite it. The officer, sensing the danger, turns to his men, who instinctively back away. Breathless and resolute, Enjolras takes the torch from Marius, ready to continue the fight.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The letter addressed to Marius is opened and read by Eponine, who appears distressed. As rain pours down, she walks through the dark, soaked streets. Meanwhile, student protesters and townspeople gather near the Place de la Bastille, with Gavroche and the urchins in the elephant. Soldiers and cavalry march down the street, followed by General Lamarque's hearse. Enjolras, waving a red flag, climbs onto the street with Marius and others. Javert is among the crowd as the cavalry confronts the protesters around the hearse. Enjolras and Marius prepare their pistols while soldiers raise swords and aim muskets. A soldier fires into the crowd, hitting a woman, and chaos ensues as cavalry charges and gunfire is exchanged. Enjolras shoots, and when Courfeyrac is knocked down, Javert, disguised as a civilian, helps him up. Marius rides down the street as a barricade is constructed from overturned carts and furniture thrown from windows. A cannon is positioned, and students fire from behind the barricade, chasing cavalry away. Marius, excited, encounters a couple as more furniture is used for the barricade. In a cafe, Javert steals a rosette and pins it to his jacket. The barricade, made of couches and carts, blocks the street, and an old woman is kissed as her chair is taken. Javert arms himself with a pistol. A red flag is thrown to Marius, and Enjolras climbs the barricade, waving the flag as people wave tricolors from windows. Javert returns, and after a brief struggle, is overpowered by the students, with Enjolras knocking him out. Enjolras and Marius, concerned, grab their weapons and join the group at the barricade. As a woman closes her shutters, the students man the barricade, aiming their weapons at the approaching soldiers. Light flickers on Enjolras's face as gunfire lights up the street. Students return fire as soldiers climb and shoot through the barricade, leaving a soldier dead on top. Marius grabs a barrel of gunpowder, and as it flames up, Gavroche calls out. Eponine, behind the barricade, grabs a musket aimed at Marius and is shot. Marius, holding a torch, lowers it towards the gunpowder, causing the officer to retreat. Breathless, Enjolras takes the torch from Marius.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The letter is addressed to Marius, a student in Paris passionate about social justice, and Eponine opens it, reads it, and looks distressed. Rain pours down, soaking the cobbled street, reminiscent of the historic streets of 19th-century Paris, as Eponine slowly walks through the darkness, soaked to the skin. Student protesters and townspeople line a street by the Place de la Bastille, a symbol of revolutionary fervor since the French Revolution, while Gavroche and the urchins are in the elephant, a makeshift refuge crafted from a disused elephant statue in the Place de la Bastille. Soldiers march down the street followed by cavalry, with the large black hearse for General Lamarque, a beloved figure among the people for his advocacy of the poor, behind them. Enjolras waves a red flag, the emblem of revolution, and climbs onto the street, joined by Marius and the others. Javert, a police inspector known for his strict adherence to the law, is in the crowd as the cavalry face the protesters, who are grouped around the hearse. Enjolras and Marius cock pistols as soldiers raise their swords and aim their muskets. A soldier shoots into the crowd, hitting a woman who collapses. Cavalry charges, and men exchange fire with the soldiers. Enjolras shoots as one of the students, Courfeyrac, a close friend of Marius, is knocked down, but Javert, dressed as a civilian to spy on the rebels, helps him up. Marius rides down the street as a cart is overturned and furniture is thrown from windows to build the barricade, the traditional symbol of uprising in Paris. A cannon, symbolizing the escalation of the conflict, is pulled into place, and students shoot from behind the barricade. People with guns chase the cavalry down the street, and protesters run through the streets. Marius finds a canoodling couple as a table is taken, and he beams with excitement while Courfeyrac calls out. Tables and pianos, representing the trappings of bourgeois life, are thrown from windows. In a café, Javert steals a rosette, a covert signal of allegiance, and pins it to his dark jacket. A couch and a cart form the barricade, which blocks the street, and an old woman is kissed as her chair is taken. Javert takes a pistol. A red flag is thrown to Marius, and Enjolras climbs onto the top of the barricade and waves the flag while people wave tricolors from their windows, showing support for the revolutionary cause. Javert returns, and they raise their weapons. Javert throws off the men holding him and lays a few punches, but the students overwhelm him as Enjolras knocks him out with a club. Enjolras and Marius look around with concern, grab their weapons, and head to the barricade with the group. A woman closes her shutters, a common act of fear and defiance, and the students man the barricade and aim their weapons. A platoon of soldiers marches up the street to face them as light flickers on Enjolras's face and sparking gunpowder lights up the street. Students return fire as soldiers climb up the barricade and shoot through it, leaving a soldier dead on top. Marius grabs a barrel of gunpowder, which flames up, and Gavroche, the spirited streetwise boy, calls out. Eponine is behind the barricade and grabs a musket aimed at Marius, getting shot in the process. Marius has a torch and lowers the flaming torch towards the gunpowder. The officer, realizing the danger, turns to his men, who back away. Breathless, Enjolras takes the torch from Marius.

Marius finds a canoodling couple as a table is taken and he beams with excitement while Courfeyrac calls out. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. Tables and pianos are thrown from windows. In a cafe Javert steals a rosette and pins it to his dark jacket. A couch and a cart form the barricade which blocks the street and an old woman is kissed as her chair is taken. Javert takes a pistol. A red flag is thrown to Marius and Enjolras climbs onto the top of the barricade and waves the flag while people wave tricolors from their windows. Javert returns and they raise their weapons. Javert throws off the men holding him and lays a few punches but the students overwhelm him as Enjolras knocks him out with a club. Enjolras and Marius look around with concern grab their weapons and head to the barricade with the group. A woman closes her shutters and the students man the barricade and aim their weapons. A platoon of soldiers marches up the street to face them as light flickers on Enjolras's face and sparking gunpowder lights up the street. Students return fire as soldiers climb up the barricade and shoot through it leaving a soldier dead on top. Marius grabs a barrel of gunpowder which flames up and Gavroche calls out. Eponine is behind the barricade and grabs a musket aimed at Marius getting shot in the process. Marius has a torch and lowers the flaming torch towards the gunpowder. The officer turns to his men who back away. Breathless Enjolras takes the torch from Marius.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: The letter is addressed to Marius and Eponine opens it reads it and looks distressed. Rain pours down soaking the cobbled street as Eponine slowly walks through the darkness soaked to the skin. Student protesters and townspeople line a street by the Place de la Bastille while Gavroche and the urchins are in the elephant. Soldiers march down the street followed by cavalry with the large black hearse for General Lamarque behind them. Enjolras waves a red flag and climbs onto the street joined by Marius and the others. Javert is in the crowd as the cavalry face the protesters who are grouped around the hearse. Enjolras and Marius cock pistols as soldiers raise their swords and aim their muskets. A soldier shoots into the crowd hitting a woman who collapses. Cavalry charges and men exchange fire with the soldiers. Enjolras shoots as one of the students. Courfeyrac is knocked down but Javert dressed as a civilian helps him up. Marius rides down the street as a cart is overturned and furniture is thrown from windows to build the barricade. A cannon is pulled into place and students shoot from behind the barricade. People with guns chase the cavalry down the street and protesters run through the streets. Marius finds a canoodling couple as a table is taken and he beams with excitement while Courfeyrac calls out. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Tables and pianos are thrown from windows. In a cafe Javert steals a rosette and pins it to his dark jacket. Javert throws off the men holding him and lays a few punches but the students overwhelm him as Enjolras knocks him out with a club. A platoon of soldiers marches up the street to face them as light flickers on Enjolras's face and sparking gunpowder lights up the street. Students return fire as soldiers climb up the barricade and shoot through it leaving a soldier dead on top. Marius grabs a barrel of gunpowder which flames up and Gavroche calls out. Eponine is behind the barricade and grabs a musket aimed at Marius getting shot in the process. Marius has a torch and lowers the flaming torch towards the gunpowder. The officer turns to his men who back away. Breathless Enjolras takes the torch from Marius.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The postcard is scribbled to Hector, and Ursula examines it, tastes it, and becomes elated. Snow cascades up, freezing the glassy river as Ursula swiftly skips through the fog, chilled to the bone. Theater performers and fishermen fill a lane by the Piazza del Colosseo, while Arlo and the puppies are in the unicorn. Bakers trot up the lane trailed by gardeners, with the tiny white bicycle for Captain Smith trailing them. Giulio spins a green kite and dives onto the lane, accompanied by Hector and the companions. Lorenzo is among the throng as the gardeners confront the performers, who are clustered around the bicycle. Giulio and Hector brandish slingshots as bakers lift their shields and point their slings. A baker hurls into the throng, striking a dog who stumbles. Gardeners stampede, and boys exchange dances with the bakers. Giulio dances as one of the performers, Carlo, is swept aside, but Lorenzo, dressed as a farmer, assists him. Hector glides up the lane as a basket is flipped and pottery is tossed from rooftops to construct the barricade. A catapult is wheeled into position, and performers hurl from behind the barricade. Children with nets chase the gardeners up the lane, and performers skip through the passages. Hector discovers a snoozing pair as a crate is seized, and he jumps with joy while Carlo chirps out. Crates and anvils plummet from lofts. In a pub, Lorenzo secures a ribbon and fastens it to his bright shirt. A couch and a carriage form the blockade, which obstructs the alley, and an ancient man is hugged as his stool is claimed. Lorenzo grabs a slingshot. A green kite is tossed to Hector, and Giulio leaps onto the peak of the barricade and spins the kite while children spin whirlwinds from their balconies. Lorenzo reappears, and they lift their nets. Lorenzo shakes off the performers gripping him and delivers several kicks, but the performers overpower him as Giulio subdues him with a rope. Giulio and Hector glance around with worry, seize their slings, and rush to the barricade with the crew. A girl latches her curtains, and the performers tend the barricade and point their nets. A squad of bakers marches down the alley to confront them as light flickers on Giulio's face and igniting fireworks brighten the lane. Performers return dance as bakers climb over the blockade and twirl through it, leaving a baker lifeless on top. Hector grabs a barrel of fireworks, which blazes up, and Arlo chirps out. Ursula is beneath the blockade and grabs a slingshot aimed at Hector, getting danced around in the process. Hector has a candle and lowers the burning candle towards the fireworks. The carpenter turns to his friends, who shuffle away. Winded, Giulio takes the candle from Hector.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The letter for Marius distresses Eponine as she reads it. Amidst pouring rain, Eponine walks through the dark street. Protesters, including Gavroche and Enjolras, gather by the Place de la Bastille, opposing soldiers who march with General Lamarque's hearse. Enjolras and Marius prepare for conflict as tensions rise between the cavalry and protesters. When gunfire erupts, a woman is hit, leading to chaos. Marius and others build a barricade, with Javert secretly amongst them. As the barricade rises, Enjolras and Marius brace for battle with their red flag flying. Javert is overpowered by students. Enjolras, Marius, and the group defend the barricade against soldiers. Marius, with a torch, almost ignites gunpowder as Eponine, shot while protecting him, clutches at the musket. Enjolras takes the torch from Marius as the defenders prepare for the next move.
